tool.name: OSMGPAddExtension

param.name: in_osmfeatures
param.dialogReference: Input feature class to which to apply the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension.
param.pythonReference: Input feature class to which to apply the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension.

tool.summary: This tool allows the user to add the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension to the input feature class.
tool.usage:
• In order to the OSM editor behavior to apply a feature class needs the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension. The feature class needs to follow the database schema defined by the downloaded OSM feature class.

  • If a feature class doesn't not have the extension then the ArcGIS standard behavior applies.

  • In order to distribute the downloaded OSM feature classes to a larger audience please consider using the Remove OSM Editor Extensiongeoprocessing tool.

scriptExample.title: Add OSM Editor Extension Sample (Python)
scriptExample.para: The following Python window script demonstrates how to add an OSM Editot extension to an existing feature class.
scriptExample.code:
# import the system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
# load the OpenStreetMap specific toolbox arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\OpenStreetMap Toolbox.tbx')
# assign the extension to existing feature class # set the workspace where the current feature class exists env.workspace = r'd:\projects\OSMEditor\WheelChairMap\default_storage.gdb'
arcpy.OSMGPAddExtension_osmtools(r'stuttgart\stuttgart_osm_pt')

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool allows the user to add the OSM (OpenStreetMap) feature class extension to the input feature class.
